question.qText: Which of the following decomposition reactions discussed previously is <font face='lc-Italic'>not</font> a redox reaction?

aBtn.aText: <font size='24'>2NaCl (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> 2Na (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) + Cl<font face='SubScript'>2</font> (<font face="c-Italic">g</font>)

<font size='24'>2H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>O (<font face="c-Italic">l</font>) <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> 2H<font face='SubScript'>2</font> (<font face="c-Italic">g</font>) + O<font face='SubScript'>2</font> (<font face="c-Italic">g</font>)

<font size='24'>KClO<font face='SubScript'>3</font> (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> KCl (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) + O<font face='SubScript'>2</font> (<font face="c-Italic">g</font>)

<font size='24'>CaCO<font face='SubScript'>3</font> (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> CaO (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) + CO<font face='SubScript'>2</font> (<font face="c-Italic">g</font>)

question.qText: Which of the following is evidence that a chemical reaction occurs during the decomposition of sodium chloride?
Which of the following reactions would best be classified as a decomposition reaction?

aBtn.aText: <font size='24'>2C<font face='SubScript'>2</font>H<font face='SubScript'>6</font> + 5O<font face='SubScript'>2</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> 2CO<font face='SubScript'>2</font> + 6H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>O

H2SO4 + Ba(OH)2 →
H2O + BaSO4
<font size='24'>H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>O<font face='SubScript'>2</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>O + O<font face='SubScript'>2</font>
